intro: Eriogonum jamiesonii, commonly known as the Jamieson's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and typically grows in dry, rocky habitats. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Its leaves are often hairy and have a distinctive shape, adapted to reduce water loss. Eriogonum jamiesonii plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological balance in its native range.
